children.text: The floating floor is excessively noisy when walked upon, with audible squeaking and creaking noises that are much more noticable than ordinarily expected for this type of flooring.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 14.06 Squeaking floors states that
‘Floors that consistently squeak by a person walking normally in a trafficable area within the first 24 months from handover are defective’ .
As the builder warrants that the work will be carried out in

, which is not the case in this area, the builder should rectify or replace the flooring, or alternatively contact the manufacturer to formally comment on the installation of the flooring, and provide the owners with copies of the correspondence.
